data.name: Super efficient Greedy Backpacker
data.description:
*This Kata does focus HEAVILY on time complexity, keep that in mind, before reading any further:

Task is to write a method, that does declare what's the highest value the backpacker can take with him on his journey, the tricky part: He can take fractions of every item as needed!

Lets say here are the items he can choose from: 
(represented inside a data container, like std::vector<>, or whatever your language does support):
Item Id: 0,1,2,3;      Size: 22,10,9,7;        Value: 19,9,9,6;

index [0] is the itemId, index [1] the size, as well as index [2] the value, stored as a 2D data container, so we can have multiples ones of those inside the outer data container!
If the backpack has only empty data containers -> return a '0' as a result!

The 2nd argument inside the method will be the maximum size the backpack has, lets say it's '25' for this example:
This will return a result of '23.1818', as due to the items 1,2 & 3 we're added, however only a fraction of item 3 and then it's corresponding value, based on how many % of it did fit inside the backpack!

That is the highest possible value, which you can achieve with packing your backpack, happy journey traveler! :)

IMPORTANT: Every item can just be added ONCE, NOT multiple times, except it's also multiples times inside the data container!

General note: There are 5 test cases that you can see and check on and a bunch of randomly generated ones!
Happy Coding!
